HelpXML.Title: unibiv
HelpXML.Purpose: unibiv has the purpose of detecting univariate and bivariate outliers

Item.Name: Y
Item.LongDesc: n x v data matrix; n observations and v variables. Rows of Y represent observations, and columns represent variables. Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values will automatically be excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: rf
Item.ShortDesc: It specifies the confidence level of the robust bivariate ellipses
Item.LongDesc: 0<rf<1. The default value is 0.95 that is the outer contour in presence of normality for each ellipse should leave outside 5% of the values.

Item.Name: robscale
Item.ShortDesc: It specifies the indexes to use to compute the dispersion of each variable and the correlation among each pair of variables

Item.Name: plots
Item.ShortDesc: It specify whether it is necessary to produce a plot with univariate standardized boxplots on the main diagonal and bivariate confidence ellipses out of the main diagonal
Item.LongDesc: If plots is equal to 1 a plot which contains univariate standardized boxplots on the main diagonal and bivariate confidence ellipses out of the main diagonal is produced on the screen. If plots is <> 1 no plot is produced. As default no plot is produced.

Item.Name: textlab
Item.ShortDesc: It controls the labels in the plots
Item.LongDesc: If textlab=1 and plots=1 the labels associated to the units which are univariate outliers or which are outside the confidence levels of the contours are displayed on the screen.

Item.Name: tag
Item.ShortDesc: It identifies the handle of the plot which is about to be created
Item.LongDesc: The default is to use tag 'pl_unibiv'. Notice that if the program finds a plot which has a tag equal to the one specified by the user, then the output of the new plot overwrites the existing one in the same window else a new window is created.

Item.Name: madcoef
Item.ShortDesc: Coefficient which is used to scale MAD coefficient to have a robust estimate of dispersion
Item.LongDesc: The default is 1.4815 so that 1.4815*MAD(N(0,1))=1. % Remark: if mad =median(y-median(y))=0 then the interquartile range is used. If also the interquartile range is 0 than the MD (mean absolute deviation) is used. In other words MD=mean(abs(y-mean(Y))

Item.Name: fre
Item.TypeInd: Details about the univariate and bivariate outliers.

References.Item: Riani, M., Zani S. (1997). An iterative method for the detection of multivariate outliers, Metron, vol. LV, pp. 101-117.

Item.Title: unibiv with all default options.
Item.Desc: Run this code to see the output shown in the help file

Item.Title: unibiv with optional arguments.
